name: 3GPPP Network Slice @ ITAv (CFS)
description: My 3GPPP Network Slice - Adapted For ITAv (CFS)

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: DL Throughput Per UE : Maximum Throughput
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description:
This attribute defines data rate supported by the network slice per UE
(Unit: kbits/s)

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: DL Throughput Per UE : Guaranteed Throughput
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description:
This attribute defines data rate supported by the network slice per UE
(Unit: kbits/s)

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: SSPEC_GRAPH_NOTATION
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: SSPEC_GRAPH_NOTATION

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: User Management Open : Support
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description:
An attribute specifies whether or not the network slice 
        supports the capability for the NSC to manage their users or groups 
        of users' network services and corresponding requirements.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Max. Packet Size : Maximum Size
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description:
This parameter specifies the maximum packet size
        supported by the network slice
(Unit: bytes)

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Max. UL Data Volume
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: Stage2 issue: Not defined in 28.541. XML and YAML says "string"

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: S-NSSAI : SST
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description:
Slice/Service Type.
Values 0 to 127 belong to standardized SST range and are defined in 3GPP TS 23.501. Values 128 to 255 belong to operator-specific range.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: PLMN : MNC
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description:
The mobile network code consists of two or three decimal digits (for example: MNC of 001 is not the same as MNC of 01.
Pattern: [0-9][0-9][0-9]|[0-9][0-9]

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Term Density : Density
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description:
An attribute specifies the overall user density over 
        the coverage area of the network slice.
(Unit: users/km2)

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Max. DL Data Volume
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: Stage2 issue: Not defined in 28.541. XML and YAML says "string"

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Resource Sharing Level
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: Specifies whether the resources to be allocated to the network slice instance may be shared with another network slice instance(s).

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Deterministic Communication : DL : Periodicity
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description:
This parameter provides the DL periodicity supported by the network slice.
This parameter must be present when the “Availability” is set to Supported.
(Units: ms)

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Coverage Area
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description:
A list of TrackingAreas where the NSI can be selected.
The TACs should be splitted with ',' 
Example: 0x1234,0x5678
Range for each TAC: 0...16777215

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Jitter
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description:
An attribute specifies the deviation from the desired value to the actual value when assessing time parameters.
(Units: microseconds)

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: DL Throughput Per Slice : Guaranteed Throughput
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description:
This attribute defines achievable data rate of the network slice in downlink that is available ubiquitously across the coverage area of the slice.
(Unit: kbits/s)

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: N6 Protection
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description:
An attribute which includes required security functions and corresponding rules of each function for network slice N6 interface protection.
The input should be a JSON string

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: V2X Communication Model : V2X Mode
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description:
An attribute specifies whether or not the V2X 
        communication mode is supported by the network slice.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: DL Throughput Per Slice : Maximum Throughput
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description:
This attribute defines achievable data rate of the network slice in downlink that is available ubiquitously across the coverage area of the slice.
(Unit: kbits/s)

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Operational State
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: The operational state of the network slice instance. It describes whether or not the resource is installed and working.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Max. Number Of UEs
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: The maximum number of UEs that may simultaneously access the network slice instance.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: UL Throughput Per UE : Guaranteed Throughput
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description:
This attribute defines data rate supported by the network slice per UE
(Unit: kbits/s)

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Survival Time
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: An attribute specifies the time that an application consuming a communication service may continue without an anticipated message.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: SST
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: Values 0 to 127 belong to standardized SST range and are defined in 3GPP TS 23.501. Values 128 to 255 belong to operator-specific range.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: NB-IoT : Support
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: An attribute specifies whether NB-IoT is supported in the RAN in the Network Slice

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Latency : UL
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description:
The packet transmission latency (milliseconds) through the RAN, CN, and TN part of 5G network, used to evaluate utilization performance of the end-to-end network slice instance.
Unit: milliseconds

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: UE Speed
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description:
An attribute specifies the maximum speed (in km/hour) supported by the network slice at which a defined QoS can be achieved.
(Units: km/h)

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: PLMN : MCC
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: The mobile country code consists of three decimal digits, The first digit of the mobile country code identifies the geographic region (the digits 1 and 8 are not used). Pattern '[02-79][0-9][0-9]'

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Reliability
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: An attribute specifies in the context of network layer packet transmissions, percentage value of the amount of sent network layer packets successfully delivered to a given system entity within the time constraint required by the targeted service, divided by the total number of sent network layer packets.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Network Slice Subnet Ref (DNN)
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: DN of Network Slice Subnet relating to the Network Slice instance

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Administrative State
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: The administrative state of the network slice instance. It describes the permission to use or prohibition against  using the instance, imposed through the OAM services.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Id
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: The ID of the Network Slice

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: KPI Monitoring : KPI List
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description:
Represents performance monitoring.
An attribute specifies the name list of KQIs and KPIs available  for performance monitoring.
The various periodicities should be expressed as "KQI#1,KPI#1,KPI#2".

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Latency : DL
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description:
The packet transmission latency (milliseconds) through the RAN, CN, and TN part of 5G network, used to evaluate utilization performance of the end-to-end network slice instance.
Unit: milliseconds

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: S-NSSAI : SD
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: Slice Differentiator. If not needed, the value can be set to FFFFFF.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Activity Factor
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description:
An attribute specifies the percentage value of the 
        amount of simultaneous active UEs to the total number of UEs where 
        active means the UEs are exchanging data with the network
(Units: decimal)

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Deterministic Communication : UL : Periodicity
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description:
This parameter provides the UL periodicity supported by the network slice.
This parameter must be present when the “Availability” is set to Supported.
(Units: ms)

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Priority Label
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: Specifies a label that consumer would assign a value on an instance of network slice subnet. The management system takes the value of this attribute into account. The effect of this attribute value to the subject managed entity is not standardized

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: UE Mobility Level
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: The mobility level of UE accessing the network slice instance.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Delay Tolerance : Support
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description:
An attribute specifies the properties of service delivery 
        flexibility, especially for the vertical services that are not 
        chasing a high system performance.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: UL Throughput Per UE : Maximum Throughput
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description:
This attribute defines data rate supported by the network slice per UE
(Unit: kbits/s)

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Availability
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description: he availability requirement for a network slice instance, expressed as a percentage.

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: UL Throughput Per Slice : Maximum Throughput
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description:
This attribute defines achievable data rate of the network slice in uplink that is available ubiquitously across the coverage area of the slice.
(Unit: kbits/s)

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: Max. Number Of PDU Sessions: Number of PDU Sessions
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description:
Represents the maximum number of 
        concurrent PDU sessions supported by the network slice

serviceSpecCharacteristic.name: UL Throughput Per Slice : Guaranteed Throughput
serviceSpecCharacteristic.description:
This attribute defines achievable data rate of the network slice in uplink that is available ubiquitously across the coverage area of the slice.
(Unit: kbits/s)
